messages.content: can i remove an edit I made using preview on a photo. i added text, how do i remove it?

If you've added text to a photo using a preview or photo editing tool and want to remove it, the ability to do so depends on a few factors:

1. **Layered Editing**: If the editing tool you used saves edits in layers (like Photoshop), and you haven't flattened or merged the layers, you can simply delete the layer containing the text.

2. **Undo Function**: If you've just added the text and haven't closed the editing session, you might be able to
it's on a Mac i used the space bar and opened the photo and added the text. it's still text, yet I don't know how to remov eit

If you've used the Preview application on a Mac to add text to a photo and the text is still editable, you can remove it by following these steps:

1. **Open the Image**: Double-click the image or right-click and select "Open With" > "Preview" to open the image in Preview.
2. **Select the Text**: Click on the 'Text Tool' (usually represented by a "T" icon) if it's not already selected. Then click on the text you've added on the image. 
3. **Delete the Text**: Once the text is selected, you should be able to press the "Delete" or "Backspace" key on your keyboard to remove it.
4. **Save the Changes**: After deleting the text, make sure to save the image to apply the changes.

If you've closed the image or saved the image after adding the text and it's no longer editable as a text layer, then, unfortunately, it's a permanent part of the image. In that case, you would need to use an image editing tool to manually erase or cover up the text. This might involve painting over the text with a color that matches the background or cloning nearby areas of the image to cover it up. If the text covers a complex background or important details, it might be a bit tricky to remove without noticeable traces.
